intro: Jasione ausfeldii, commonly known as the Alpine bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. Jasione ausfeldii is often found in mountain meadows and is adapted to cold, harsh climates.
